conclusion: Need to calculate induced emf and current using Faraday's law.
Wire frame rotates around vertical axis coinciding with side cd.
Magnetic field B is uniform and horizontal.
Area of the wire frame is S.
Resistance of the wire frame is R.
Angular velocity of rotation is ω.
Magnetic flux Φ is B * S * cos(θ).
Initial magnetic flux Φ is B * S when θ = 0°.
Magnetic flux after 60° rotation is B * S / 2.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is -B * S / 2.
Average induced emf is -3B * S * ω / (2π).
Instantaneous emf at 60° is -B * S * ω * sqrt(3) / 2.
Instantaneous current I is -B * S * ω * sqrt(3) / (2R).
Instantaneous induced current at 60° is -B * S * ω * sqrt(3) / (2R).
Average induced emf during 0° to 60° is -3B * S * ω / (2π).
